author: Manish Sahu
title: 2017 Lucknow case: Gangster, 7 aides get life term for oil trader murder
text:
- India
International
2017 Lucknow case: Gangster, 7 aides get life term for oil trader murder
The trader allegedly faced threats from gangster Akeel Ansari who warned him not to pursue his son’s murder case
A CBI court in Lucknow on Thursday sentenced gangster Akeel Ansari and seven of his associates to life imprisonment for their alleged involvement in the murder of a Lucknow-based oil trader in February 2017.
It was alleged that Shrawan Sahu (55), the trader, faced threats from gangster Akeel Ansari, who had warned him not to pursue the murder case of his son Ayush Sahu (26) who was shot dead outside a beer shop in 2013.
Ansari was the prime accused in Ayush’s murder.
In 2020, a court in
Lucknow had sentenced Ansari and his associate Azeem Khan, alias Babu to life imprisonment for Ayush’s murder.
After Shrawan refused to comply with the gangster’s instructions, he was shot dead by two assailants at his residence in the Saadatganj area of Lucknow, it was alleged. He had sustained five bullets.
Eight persons, including Ansari, were booked in connection with the murder. The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) took over the investigation on the recommendation of the state government.
On Thursday, the court found Ansari, Satyam Patel, Azeem Khan, Aman Singh, Vivek Verma, Ajay Patel, Rohit Mishra, and Faisal guilty under Sections 302 (murder) and 120-B (criminal conspiracy) of the Indian Penal Code. Aman, Vivek, Ajay, Rohit, Azeem and Faisal, who were out on bail, were taken into custody. Ansari and Satyam Patel were already in jail.
Ashish Kumar Saxena, senior public prosecutor for the CBI, said the court examined 51 prosecution witnesses and reviewed 101 documentary exhibits, 51 material exhibits during the trial. Seven defence witnesses were also examined by the court, he added.
According to the prosecution, it was found during the investigation that Ansari initially threatened Shrawan to dissuade him from pursuing his son’s murder case.
Ansari then tried to frame Sahu in a false criminal case to exert pressure on him. When even this didn’t work, Ansari then orchestrated Sahu’s murder with the help of his associates, it was alleged.
Five days before eliminating Sahu, Ansari surrendered before a court in another case to evade police suspicion and that his associates executed the murder when he himself was behind bars, it was claimed.
The CCTV cameras installed at Sahu’s shop played a crucial role in identifying the assailants, the investigators said. It was found that Sahu’s murder was premeditated with a thorough reconnaissance conducted by the accused.
In the Ayush murder case, the police had filed charges against Akeel and his associate Azeem alias Baba. In January 2017, a case was filed against Shrawan, accusing him of hiring shooters to kill Akeel. But during the investigation, these allegations were found to be baseless and a closure report was filed, according to the prosecuting officer.
After filing chargesheet, the CBI had recommended a departmental inquiry against the then Lucknow Senior Superintendent of Police (SSP) Manzil Saini, alleging negligence in the Shrawan murder case. But an inquiry panel formed by the state government this year to probe the allegations against Saini gave him a clean chit, sources said.

author: GABRIEL MARTÍNEZ RUBIO
title: Checo Pérez contradice a Helmut Marko, y asegura que está firme en su asiento
text:
Si Helmut Marko no se cansa de decir que el futuro de Checo Pérez dentro de Red Bull pende de un hilo, al mexicano lo tiene sin cuidado.
Con firmeza y actitud positiva, llegó Pérez al Gran Premio de Bélgica de la Fórmula 1 , que arranca actividades este viernes. Y era un hecho que los medios le iban a preguntar sobre su estabilidad dentro del equipo, a falta de este último fin de semana antes del parón veraniego.
Las palabras de Marko, asesor de Red Bull, le entran a Checo por un oído y le salen por el otro. Concentrado en tener un fin de semana redondo, afirmó que cumplirá su contrato por lo menos hasta 2026 .
“Estoy seguro… Sé básicamente lo que está en mi contrato y sé lo que el equipo confía en mí . Y sé dónde está el foco principal, que es cumplir en la pista”, afirmó.
Te puede interesar: “Espero estar en esas conversaciones": Yuki Tsunoda, sobre el asiento de Checo Pérez
Al ser recordado sobre las palabras de Helmut Marko , quien aseguró que tras la carrera de este fin de semana se analizará la continuidad del mexicano, Pérez se desentendió completamente sobre las razones que han llevado al expiloto a ser tan insistente en ello. “Creo que es algo que hay que preguntarle a él. No lo sé” , recalcó sobre las insinuaciones.
Y es que no es la primera vez que Checo Pérez está envuelto en puras especulaciones a su alrededor. Y no tiene planeado caer en ellas, y mucho menos cuando encara un fin de semana tan importante. “No he hablado de eso sobre ese punto en particular. Como he dicho, siento que todo el equipo está totalmente concentrado en volver a la pista , en encarrilar nuestra temporada, y el resto es pura especulación”.
Te puede interesar: ¡Fuerte penalización!: Max Verstappen no podrá largar en el Top 10 en Bélgica
REUTERS
¿Cuándo es la próxima carrera de Checo Pérez? Checo Pérez correrá con Red Bull en el próximo Gran Premio de Hungría , que arranca actividades el viernes 26 de julio y culmina el domingo 28 del mismo mes.
Te puede interesar: Las palabras que dedicó Christian Horner a Checo Pérez, tras el Gran Premio de Hungría

author: Syed Khalid Hussain Hussain
title: 'Naya Kashmir': New Year Celebration Takes Centerstage At Historic Lal Chowk Defying Terrorism | India News | Zee News
text: 'Naya Kashmir': New Year Celebration Takes Centerstage At Historic Lal Chowk Defying Terrorism The locals as well as the tourists visiting Kashmir Valley attended the function and were extremely excited about the celebrations at the very famous clock tower in Srinagar. Trending Photos For the first time in the last many decades of Jammu and Kashmir, New Year celebrations were held at Srinagar’s Lal Chowk area. The Department of Tourism, Jammu and Kashmir had organized a musical event at Srinagar’s Ghanta Ghar (Clock Tower area). Hundreds of people gathered at the clock tower to participate in the New Year celebrations. The locals as well as the tourists visiting Kashmir Valley attended the function and were extremely excited about the celebrations at the very famous clock tower in Srinagar. The locals from various parts of Srinagar city attended these New Year celebrations and were extremely excited to be a part of it. Watch The Ground Report [#BreakingNews]: श्रीनगर के लाल चौक पर नए साल का जश्न, कश्मीर के युवा लाल चौक पर मना रहे जश्न [#Deshhit] [#Srinagar] [#JammuKashmir] [#HappyNewYear2024] [#NewYearCelebration]| [@priyasi90] [@timechangelives] [pic.twitter.com/wJ1QQW2KOA]— Zee News (@ZeeNews) [December 31, 2023] A local girl said, "I am extremely excited to be here today. I heard about these celebrations being held at the clock tower in Srinagar and I asked my father to take me here so that I can be a witness to it. Lal Chowk has never seen these scenes before and being a part of the celebrations makes me feel lucky. I am also liking the lighting and decorations that have been done across Srinagar city, especially at Lal Chowk, which has completely changed now after being converted into a smart city." The tourists visiting the Kashmir Valley were also surprised to see celebrations being held at Srinagar‘s Clock Tower area. Tourist resorts like Gulmarg, Pahalgam and Sonmarg are completely sold out and all the hotels and guest houses are fully booked. The tourist footfall has been increasing in the valley and the administration hopes that 2024 will create new records. “We wanted to be in Kashmir on New Year. We wanted to experience the charm and now we are seeing the celebrations being held at the Lal Chowk. We are super excited. We have already been to Gulmarg Pahalgam and Sonamarg and we are planning to go to some other places as well. We are enjoying our trip to Kashmir Valley and ask others to come to Kashmir once as well," said a tourist Ramesh Singh. The Department of Tourism has organised many celebratory functions on the eve of New Year’s across the Kashmir Valley. The key resorts in Gulmarg will have performers coming from across India To celebrate New Year. Live Tv

author: web.help@express.co.uk (Ayaan Ali)
title: Gordon and Tana Ramsay cradle sons, baby Jesse and Oscar, 4, in adorable snap
text:
Holly Ramsay, daughter of celebrity chef Gordon Ramsay, has shared a series of heartwarming family photos on Instagram.
One picture shows Gordon, 57, and Tana, 49, cradling one-month-old son Jesse, along with little Oscar, four.
The family had been enjoying some festive time together at The Savoy Grill in London, a five-star restaurant owned by Gordon.
Holly, 23, who is dating athlete Adam Peaty, looked stunning in a red jumpsuit as she held baby Jesse while also enjoying a cocktail.
Sharing the photos, Holly wished everyone "a very merry
Christmas". Her followers were quick to comment, with one saying: "Your little brothers are adorable. Merry Christmas to you and your family", while another added: "Love your family."
Gordon's wife, Tana, recently shared the good news on Instagram that he had returned home just in time for Christmas.
She said: "Daddy has arrived home now Christmas can really begin. @gordongram we love you."
Unfortunately, due to work, Gordon missed out on some early moments with their latest bundle of joy, Jesse.
The couple, who have been married for 26 years, are parents to Megan, 25, twins Jack and Holly, 23, Tilly who is 22, Oscar, aged four and newborn baby Jesse.
They announced the surprise arrival of their sixth child saying: "What an amazing birthday present, please welcome Jesse James Ramsay, 7lbs 10oz whopper." and "One more bundle of love to the Ramsay brigade!! 3 boys, 3 girls... Done."
Tana reflected on her pregnancy journey saying: "It's been a nerve-wracking 9 months, but we've made it, and we have been blessed with this little bundle." She confirmed: "Ramsay family definitely complete. Jesse James Ramsay, we love you so much."
Tana has bravely shared her experience of suffering a devastating miscarriage in 2016. She said: "A happy picture taken of us celebrating Megan's 18th, I was just under 20 weeks pregnant. Little did we know, a few days later, I would be holding our little boy Rocky born with a strong heartbeat, but too little to survive."
She continued, "Although it's 7 years today, it still feels like yesterday. We all miss you every day. We love you, Rocky, forever in our hearts. I couldn't do this without my family, you are all everything to me xxx."
Gordon also opened up about the loss, telling People Magazine: "Losing Rocky was really tough, and then just being there and watching the trauma unfold, it's just this life-changing moment."
* This article was crafted with the help of an AI engine, which speeds up OK!'s editorial research and applies it to article templates created by journalists in our newsrooms. An OK! editor reviewed this content before it was published. You can report any errors to

author: VNExplorer
title: BJP says ‘Congress hates Muslims’ after MLA claimed harassment over religion
text:
Baba Siddique is a former minister. His son Zeeshan Siddique won his first election in 2019
Mumbai: Congress MLA Zeeshan Siddique, who was sacked as the president of the Mumbai Youth Congress earlier this week, has claimed he was being harassed within the party because he is a Muslim. The MLA from Vandre East is the son of Baba Siddique, who recently quit the Congress joined Ajit Pawar’s Nationalist Congress Party. Reacting to the remarks, the BJP said ‘Congress hates Muslims.
At a press conference on Thursday, he said the Congress had the worst form of communalism among all his parties. “I won’t say I will remain in the Congress, but I will discuss my political options with my supporters (first),” he said.
Zeeshan Siddique said he communicated to the party that his father’s exit shouldn’t have a bearing on his association with the Congress.
“I have been repeatedly saying that even though my father Baba Siddique joined the NCP, I will remain with the Congress, but still action was taken against me,” he said.
He claimed he bagged 90 percent votes in the election for the Mumbai Youth Congress president’s post but the party took nine months to appoint him to the post.
“I was harassed a lot because I am a Muslim,” he said.
He said Muslims have no place in the Congress.
“In Mumbai and Karnataka, two Muslim candidates won Youth wing elections but it took nearly a year for them to get the post in both cases,” he said. Zeeshan also said he felt bad about the Congress being in alliance with the Shiv Sena led by Uddhav Thackeray (as part of the Maha Vikas Aghadi), when Thackeray, at a solidarity rally of the alliance in Mumbai, praised the demolition of Babri mosque. Rahul Gandhi was doing good work but his team was ‘extremely corrupt,” he alleged.
He also claimed that Congress chief Mallikarjun Kharge is not allowed to work freely in the copy.
“Mallikarjun Kharge is such a senior leader but even his hands are tied. Rahul Gandhi is doing his job but it looks as if people around him have taken a ‘supari’ (contract) from other parties to finish off the Congress,” he alleged.
BJP leader Shehzad Poonawalla said Zeeshan Siddique’s allegation has proved that the Congress uses the minorities for vote bank politics.
“Today Zeeshan Siddiqui has spilled out the beans which was told by me six-seven years ago that Congress is the most anti-Muslim party. It may project for the vote bank and for appeasement’s sake that it is with the minorities. But actually, it has done the most damage to minorities. Today Zeeshan Siddiqui is facing it himself. We have seen that Congress allowed riot after riot to be orchestrated. Congress party used to say that Uddhav Sena is responsible for the Mumbai riots but today they have allied with them because Congress hates Muslims,” he said.
“They only keep them as their vote bank. In Congress, apart from ‘Parivaar’, nobody can take decisions. What Zeeshan is facing today, Congress leaders had been facing for a long time because Rahul Gandhi is promoting such a culture,” Poonawalla added.
Several Maharashtra Congress leaders have exited the party lately, including Milind Deora and Ashok Chavan. While Deora joined Eknath Shinde’s Shiv Sena, Chavan joined the BJP.
With inputs from ANI, PTI
